ca.weblite.pdfclown.documents.contents.fonts

Class CJKFont

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pdfclown.objects.PdfObjectWrapper<org.pdfclown.objects.PdfDictionary>
      • org.pdfclown.documents.contents.fonts.Font
        • ca.weblite.pdfclown.documents.contents.fonts.CJKFont
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, org.pdfclown.objects.IPdfObjectWrapper

    public class CJKFont
extends org.pdfclown.documents.contents.fonts.Font

    A Font for PDFClown that supports Chinese (Simplified & Traditional), Japanese, and Korean characters. It uses TCPDF's (http://www.tcpdf.org/) CID0 unicode fonts for the font information (e.g. character widths). It actually parses the PHP files directly to get this information.

    This could probably be adapted to parse font files directly but I found the PHP files more accessible at this point.

    All of these languages specify that the ArialUnicodeMS font should be used for rendering the Unicode text. This requires that your PDF reader has this font installed. Typically, Adobe Reader will pop up with a message saying that some fonts require the CJK language pack in order to work properly, then it will just download the font kit and allow you to load the document.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static CJKFont get(org.pdfclown.documents.Document context,
          java.lang.String path)
        Loads a TCPDFFont by providing the PHP file's path.
        Parameters:
        context - The document to add the font to.
        path - The path to the font's PHP file. I.e. a file inside the "fonts" directory of the TCPDF distribution.
        Returns:
        A font that can be used to render text in a document.
        See Also:
        loadChineseSimplified(), loadJapanese(), loadKorean(), loadChineseTraditional()

      • get

        protected static CJKFont get(org.pdfclown.documents.Document context,
          java.io.InputStream is)
        Loads a TCPDFFont by providing an input stream to the PHP font file. If you use this method, you need to make sure that the supporting files are in the classpath in the same package as the TCPDFFont class, because when the parser encounters an include() statement it will try to load the file using Class.getResourceAsStream()
        Parameters:
        context - The PDF file to which the font is to be added.
        is - The input stream with the PHP font file.
        Returns:
        The font.
        See Also:
        loadChineseSimplified(), loadJapanese(), loadKorean(), loadChineseTraditional()

      • loadChineseSimplified

      • onLoad

        protected void onLoad()
        Specified by:
        onLoad in class org.pdfclown.documents.contents.fonts.Font

      • load

        protected void load()
        Loads the font from either a file located at this.path, or an InputStream referenced in this.fontInputStream. This will parse the PHP file for the font information and build the appropriate PDF data structure.

        Note that you must assign one of this.path or this.fontInputStream for this to work. fontInputStream takes precendence if both are non-null.

        Overrides:
        load in class org.pdfclown.documents.contents.fonts.Font
